## Code Quality Checklist

### Code
- [ ] Code follows project style guidelines
- [ ] Self-review of code completed
- [ ] Code is well-commented, particularly in complex areas
- [ ] No hardcoded values (use configuration/constants)
- [ ] No console.log or System.out.println statements left in code
- [ ] Error handling implemented appropriately

### Testing
- [ ] Test coverage meets minimum threshold (80%)
- [ ] Tests are meaningful and test actual behavior
- [ ] Edge cases are tested
- [ ] No flaky tests

### Documentation
- [ ] API endpoints documented (Swagger/OpenAPI)
- [ ] README updated if needed
- [ ] Code comments added where necessary
- [ ] Migration scripts documented (if applicable)

### Security
- [ ] No sensitive data (passwords, tokens, keys) committed
- [ ] Input validation implemented
- [ ] SQL injection prevention verified
- [ ] XSS prevention verified (if applicable)

### Performance
- [ ] No N+1 queries
- [ ] Appropriate indexes added (if database changes)
- [ ] Large result sets paginated
- [ ] Caching implemented where appropriate

## Database Changes
<!-- If this PR includes database changes, describe them -->

- [ ] Migration scripts added (Flyway/Liquibase)
- [ ] Migration scripts tested on local environment
- [ ] Migration scripts are reversible (down migration)
- [ ] No breaking changes to existing data
- [ ] Not applicable
